definition: Ainu (ethnic group of Japan's north and Russia's east)
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
flatter
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]

(old) third person singular pronoun ("he" or "she")/second person singular pronoun ("you")/(May 4th period) third person singular feminine pronoun ("she")/(Classical Chinese) introductory particle with no specific meaning/that (preceding a noun)
surname Yi/abbr. for 伊拉克[Yi1 la1 ke4], Iraq/abbr. for 伊朗[Yi1 lang3], Iran
to exert/to strive

sentences.english: Little about the Ainu are taught in Japanese schools.
sentences.chinese: 日本的學校裏很少會學習關於阿伊努的知識。

sentences.english: Shiretoko's original inhabitants, the Ainu, had referred to the peninsula as the end of the world.
sentences.chinese: 知牀的原住民阿伊努人把這個半島看作是世界的盡頭。

sentences.english: The Ainu look like a mixture of Asian and Caucasian.
sentences.chinese: 阿伊努人長得像亞洲人和高加索人的混合體。

sentences.english: The , the indigenous people of Japan, traditionally wore facial tattoos.
sentences.chinese: 阿伊努人，土著人的日本，傳統穿著紋面。

sentences.english: The Ainu settlers in Hokkaido are the last remnant of a prehistoric race.
sentences.chinese: 北海道的阿伊努人是史前某個種族的最後殘存者。

sentences.english: Hokkaido is one of the residences of A'YiNu people.
sentences.chinese: 北海道是阿伊努民族的居住地之一。

sentences.english: The Ainu had Japan's northern Hokkaido Island nearly to themselves for hundreds of years.
sentences.chinese: 阿伊努人居住在日北本，北方的北海道數百年了。

sentences.english: Incidentally, Japan has indigenous people, the Ainu.
sentences.chinese: 偶然的是，日本也有土著人，就是阿伊努人。

sentences.english: Today, only vestigialcommunities of Ainu survive.
sentences.chinese: 現在，只有退化的阿伊努族羣還倖存下來。

definition: Maori, indigenous Polynesian people of New Zealand
Inuit (politically correct term for Eskimo 愛斯基摩人|爱斯基摩人)
the Sami people, indigenous people in northern Scandinavia

Emishi or Ebisu, ethnic group of ancient Japan, thought to be related to modern Ainus

Jyōmon period of Japanese prehistory, with rope pattern pottery
(Tw) (American) Indian/native American/indigenous peoples of the Americas/also written 印第安[Yin4 di4 an1]
Paiwan, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan
American Indians
Gaoshan aborigines (Taiwan), "mountain tribes" (Tw)/Taiwanese aborigines (PRC)
Bunun, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan
Ewenke ethnic group of Inner Mongolia
Thao, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan
indigenous person/aboriginal
